Module com.dlsc.gemsfx
Package com.dlsc.gemsfx

Class TimePicker

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.layout.Region
javafx.scene.control.Control
javafx.scene.control.ComboBoxBase<LocalTime>
com.dlsc.gemsfx.TimePicker
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget, javafx.scene.control.Skinnable
public class TimePicker extends javafx.scene.control.ComboBoxBase<LocalTime>
A control for letting the user enter a time of day (see LocalTime). The control can be configured to only enter a time within a given time range. It can also be configured to show hours and minutes, or hours and minutes and seconds, or hours and minutes and seconds and milliseconds (see formatProperty())

    • stepRateInMinutes

      public final javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty stepRateInMinutesProperty
      Stores the "step rate" used by the control when the user increases or decreases the minutes field. The step rate can be used to (for example) make the minutes increase or decrease by 15 minutes every time the user presses the arrow up or down keys.
      See Also:
      • getStepRateInMinutes()
      • setStepRateInMinutes(int)
      • stepRateInMinutesProperty()

    • clockType

      public final javafx.beans.property.ObjectProperty<TimePicker.ClockType> clockTypeProperty
      The clock type determines whether the control will display 24 or 12 hours. If the control shows 12 hours then an additional field for choosing between the "am" or "pm" meridian will be added.
      See Also:
      • getClockType()
      • setClockType(TimePicker.ClockType)
      • clockTypeProperty()

    • linkingFields

      public final javafx.beans.property.BooleanProperty linkingFieldsProperty
      A property used to control whether the fields should automatically increase or decrease the previous field when they reach their upper or lower limit.
      See Also:
      • isLinkingFields()
      • setLinkingFields(boolean)
      • linkingFieldsProperty()

    • rollover

      public final javafx.beans.property.BooleanProperty rolloverProperty
      A flag used to signal whether the time fields should start at the beginning of its value range when it reaches the end of it. E.g. incrementing hour 23 would result in hour 0 when the user tries to increase it by one.
      See Also:
      • isRollover()
      • setRollover(boolean)
      • rolloverProperty()

    • onShowPopup

      public final javafx.beans.property.ObjectProperty<Consumer<TimePicker>> onShowPopupProperty
      This consumer will be invoked to bring up a control for entering the time without using the keyboard. The default implementation shows a popup.
      See Also:
      • getOnShowPopup()
      • setOnShowPopup(Consumer)
      • onShowPopupProperty()

    • format

      public final javafx.beans.property.ObjectProperty<TimePicker.Format> formatProperty
      The format used by the picker, e.g. "hours and minutes", or "hours, minutes, and seconds".
      See Also:
      • getFormat()
      • setFormat(TimePicker.Format)
      • formatProperty()

    • minutesSeparator

      public final javafx.beans.property.ObjectProperty<javafx.scene.Node> minutesSeparatorProperty
      The node that will be placed between the minutes and the seconds field. The default separator is a label with text ":".
      See Also:

      • minutesSeparatorProperty()

    • secondsSeparator

      public final javafx.beans.property.ObjectProperty<javafx.scene.Node> secondsSeparatorProperty
      The node that will be placed between the seconds and the milliseconds field. The default separator is a label with text ".".
      See Also:
      • getSecondsSeparator()

      • secondsSeparatorProperty()

    • adjust

      public final void adjust()
      Adjusts the time picker's time based on the earliest and latest time allowed and also based on the step rate currently in effect.

    • getTime

    • getStepRateInMinutes

      public final int getStepRateInMinutes()
      Gets the value of the stepRateInMinutes property.
      Property description:
      Stores the "step rate" used by the control when the user increases or decreases the minutes field. The step rate can be used to (for example) make the minutes increase or decrease by 15 minutes every time the user presses the arrow up or down keys.
      Returns:
      the value of the stepRateInMinutes property
      See Also:
      • setStepRateInMinutes(int)
      • stepRateInMinutesProperty()

    • stepRateInMinutesProperty

      public final javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty stepRateInMinutesProperty()
      Stores the "step rate" used by the control when the user increases or decreases the minutes field. The step rate can be used to (for example) make the minutes increase or decrease by 15 minutes every time the user presses the arrow up or down keys.
      Returns:
      the step rate in minutes
      See Also:
      • getStepRateInMinutes()
      • setStepRateInMinutes(int)

    • getClockType

      public final TimePicker.ClockType getClockType()
      Gets the value of the clockType property.
      Property description:
      The clock type determines whether the control will display 24 or 12 hours. If the control shows 12 hours then an additional field for choosing between the "am" or "pm" meridian will be added.
      Returns:
      the value of the clockType property
      See Also:
      • setClockType(TimePicker.ClockType)
      • clockTypeProperty()

    • clockTypeProperty

      public final javafx.beans.property.ObjectProperty<TimePicker.ClockType> clockTypeProperty()
      The clock type determines whether the control will display 24 or 12 hours. If the control shows 12 hours then an additional field for choosing between the "am" or "pm" meridian will be added.
      Returns:
      the type of the clock
      See Also:
      • getClockType()
      • setClockType(TimePicker.ClockType)

    • setClockType

    • isRollover

      public final boolean isRollover()
      Gets the value of the rollover property.
      Property description:
      A flag used to signal whether the time fields should start at the beginning of its value range when it reaches the end of it. E.g. incrementing hour 23 would result in hour 0 when the user tries to increase it by one.
      Returns:
      the value of the rollover property
      See Also:
      • setRollover(boolean)
      • rolloverProperty()

    • rolloverProperty

      public final javafx.beans.property.BooleanProperty rolloverProperty()
      A flag used to signal whether the time fields should start at the beginning of its value range when it reaches the end of it. E.g. incrementing hour 23 would result in hour 0 when the user tries to increase it by one.
      Returns:
      true if the fields should rollover
      See Also:
      • isRollover()
      • setRollover(boolean)

    • setRollover

      public final void setRollover(boolean rollover)
      Sets the value of the rollover property.
      Property description:
      A flag used to signal whether the time fields should start at the beginning of its value range when it reaches the end of it. E.g. incrementing hour 23 would result in hour 0 when the user tries to increase it by one.
      Parameters:
      rollover - the value for the rollover property
      See Also:
      • isRollover()
      • rolloverProperty()
